name: Fathom
description: Fathom is an AI-powered meeting notetaker that automatically transcribes and summarizes meetings from platforms like Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams. It aims to free up users to focus on conversations rather than note-taking, providing quick summaries, action items, and searchable transcripts.

features: 30 days of Fathom Premium for free

core: Automatic meeting recording and transcription
AI-powered meeting summaries
Action item identification
Searchable transcripts
Highlighting and bookmarking key moments
Sharing of meeting clips and summaries
CRM integrations (Salesforce, Hubspot, Close)
Integration with tools like Slack, Google Docs, Gmail, Zapier
Support for multiple languages
SOC2 and HIPAA compliance
Free forever plan with unlimited recording, transcription, and summarization

pros: Significantly saves time by automating note-taking and summarization
Allows users to be more present and engaged in meetings
Generous free tier with unlimited core features
Wide range of integrations with popular business tools
Strong focus on privacy and security
cons: Premium features require a paid subscription.
While the free version is generous, advanced AI features are behind a paywall.
targetAudience: Professionals, Sales Teams, Customer Success Teams, Founders, Operations Teams, Managers, Product Teams, Marketing Teams, Freelancers, Virtual Assistants

name: Nyota
description: Nyota is an AI-powered notetaker designed to align sales, support, and project teams by automating data entry and call workflows. It integrates with meeting platforms to capture notes, action items, and key details, automatically updating CRMs and project management tools. Nyota aims to keep teams focused, organized, and stress-free by handling the administrative tasks associated with meetings.

core: Automated data entry and call workflows
CRM and project tool updates from meeting notes
Comprehensive, high-quality meeting notes
Support for Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams
Captures decisions, action items, and key points
Supports 90+ languages
Automatic syncing of notes and tasks to CRMs and project management tools
AI agent for asking questions about meeting content
Customizable reporting with 20+ built-in templates (BANT, SPICED, MEDDICC, etc.)
Ability to create custom workflows
Integration with calendars for automatic meeting joining
Option to invite meet@nyota.ai to meetings
Summaries tailored for different meeting types (lead qualification, discovery calls, daily updates, retrospectives)
Sharing notes to platforms like Slack, Hubspot, Salesforce, Close, OneDrive, Notion, Google Drive
Insights and pattern recognition from meeting data
Privacy by design with data ownership, no voice recording storage, and data deletion tools
Encryption of data at rest

pros: Automates tedious meeting-related tasks, saving time and increasing productivity.
Enhances preparation and focus during meetings by handling note-taking.
Provides visibility and insights into conversations, aiding better decision-making.
Improves team communication and collaboration through shared, clear action items.
Offers a deeper understanding of meetings and business trends.
Strong emphasis on privacy and data ownership.
cons: No explicit mention of pricing tiers or costs.
Specific details about the AI's capabilities beyond note-taking are not fully elaborated.
useCases: Aligning sales, support, and project teams
Automating data entry and call workflows
Updating CRMs and project tools from meeting notes
Keeping CRMs up to date with meeting summaries
Sharing solution designs with implementation teams
Keeping stakeholders aligned with automated updates
Sharing interview feedback with hiring managers
Tracking action items from planning meetings
